newsitem.title: CHINA: China says satellite reaches proper orbit.
newsitem.headline: China says satellite reaches proper orbit.

text.p: China said on Tuesday a communications satellite launched last week had successfully reached synchronous orbit.

The Dongfanhong-3 (East is Red) satellite, launched aboard a domestic Long March 3A rocket, would soon put its 24 C-band transponders into service and boost China's communications capacity, state television said.
"This has great significance for consolidating our nation's status in the international satellite launch market," television said.
China had announced last week that the satellite had reached a quasi-synchronous orbit and that all systems were operating normally.

International insurers had been awaiting the launch of the Dongfanghong-3, which followed the failure of two major launches last year, saying a third loss could drive up already inflated premiums on Chinese launches.
